titles.title: Long Have I Sought For Happiness

properties.verseOrder: v1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6 v7 v8

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: Long have I sought for happiness, But where can it be found? Only, dear Saviour in Thy grace, Where purest joys abound.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: A moment's space without God Creates in me a hell; But when He sheds His love abroad, What raptures do I feel!

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: Lord, if a transient sight of Thee Affords us such a feast, How glorious will that vision be, Which shall forever last?

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: When shall we, Lord, Thy glory see In light without a shade, The glort which surrounded Thee Before the world was made?

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: What cares, infirmities and pains Oppress our feeble frame? Immortal health and vigor reigns In presence if the Lamb.

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: We now but darkly thro' the glass Behold the God we own; Then shall we see Him face to face, And know as we are known.

verse.name: v7
verse.lines: Then satan with his fiery darts Shall us no more molest; His arrows cannot reach our hearts When we in glory rest.

verse.name: v8
verse.lines: The world shall no more charm eyes, Nor captive our hearts, Our soluls to nobler pleasures rise, Which God Himself imparts.
